## Overview

The object value of an `NSImageCell` object must be an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSImage] object, so if you use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/objectValue] method of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell], be sure to supply an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSImage] object as an argument. Because an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSImage] object does not need to be converted for display, do not use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell] methods relating to formatters.

An `NSImageCell` object is usually associated with some kind of control object. For example, an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMatrix] or an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView].

When subclassing `NSImageCell` you must implement all of the designated initializers. Those methods are: init, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/init(coder:)], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/init(textCell:)], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/init(imageCell:)].

# NSImageCell

**Class**

An `NSImageCell` object displays a single image (encapsulated in an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSImage] object) in a frame. This class provides methods for choosing the frame and for aligning and scaling the image to fit the frame.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class NSImageCell
```

## Overview

The object value of an `NSImageCell` object must be an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSImage] object, so if you use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/objectValue] method of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell], be sure to supply an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSImage] object as an argument. Because an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSImage] object does not need to be converted for display, do not use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell] methods relating to formatters.

An `NSImageCell` object is usually associated with some kind of control object. For example, an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMatrix] or an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView].

### Designated Initializers

When subclassing `NSImageCell` you must implement all of the designated initializers. Those methods are: init, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/init(coder:)], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/init(textCell:)], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/init(imageCell:)].

## Aligning and Scaling the Image

- **imageAlignment**: The alignment of the receiver’s image relative to its frame.
- **imageScaling**: The scaling mode used to fit the receiver’s image into the frame.

## Choosing the Frame

- **imageFrameStyle**: The style of the frame that borders the image.

## Constants

- **NSImageAlignment**: Constants used by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSImageCell/imageAlignment] that allow you to specify the location of the image in the frame.
- **NSImageView.FrameStyle**: Constants that allow you to specify the kind of frame bordering the image.

## Inherits From

- NSCell

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSAccessibilityElementProtocol
- NSAccessibilityProtocol
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSUserInterfaceItemIdentification
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
